law.catch_line: A society may admit to membership an individual who:...

section.section:
A society may admit to membership an individual who:
is older than 14 1/2 years old; and
gives the society evidence of insurability acceptable to the society.

A minor who is admitted to the society is:
bound by the terms of the application and certificate and by the laws and rules of the society; and
entitled to the rights and privileges of membership as though the individual were an adult at the time of application.

text.section: A society also may admit general or social members who do not have a voice or vote in the management of the society's insurance affairs.
The members of a grand, supreme, or subordinate lodge or branch of a society are not personally liable for payment of a benefit provided by the society.
A society shall specify in its laws or rules the rights and privileges of each membership class.
Membership rights in a society are personal to the member and not assignable.
